Tasks.Task Description: Use Azure Monitor to continuously track the health and performance of Virtual Machines. Set up alerts for CPU, memory, and disk usage thresholds.
Regularly update the operating system and applications on Virtual Machines with the latest security patches to mitigate vulnerabilities.
Schedule regular backups of Virtual Machines using Azure Backup to ensure data resiliency and recovery options.
Analyze performance metrics and optimize Virtual Machine configurations, such as resizing or changing disk types, to meet workload requirements.

Tasks.Task: Conduct Failover and Disaster Recovery Tests
Tasks.Task Description: Test failover and disaster recovery mechanisms to ensure Virtual Machines can recover in case of outages or failures.
Perform regular audits of Virtual Machine security settings, including firewall rules, access controls, and encryption configurations.
Ensure Virtual Machines are using the latest base images for operating systems and applications. Replace outdated images as needed.
Keep documentation for Virtual Machine configurations, operational procedures, and troubleshooting guides up-to-date.
Verify that Virtual Machines comply with organizational policies and industry regulations, such as GDPR or HIPAA.
Regularly rotate access credentials, such as SSH keys or passwords, to enhance security for Virtual Machines.
Analyze Virtual Machine usage and costs to identify opportunities for savings, such as shutting down unused VMs or resizing instances.
Regularly test network connectivity for Virtual Machines to ensure they can communicate with required resources and services.
Enable diagnostic settings for Virtual Machines and monitor logs for any unusual activity or errors.

Tasks.Task: Plan for VM Upgrades and Expansions
Tasks.Task Description: Develop and execute plans for upgrading or expanding Virtual Machine resources to meet future workload demands.
Ensure the operations team participates in regular training to stay updated with new Virtual Machine features and best practices.
